snippet: Ali Hussein Kadhim, an Iraqi soldier, was captured with hundreds of other soldiers by Sunni militants in June. As a Shiite, he was marked for death. [Video includes graphic images.]
abstract: Ali Hussein Kadhim, Iraqi soldier and Shiite, recounts how he survived June massacre of Iraqi soldiers stationed at Camp Speicher in Tikrit by Islamic State in Iraq and Syria militants; an estimated 1,700 Shiite soldiers were killed in the bloodshed, making it the deadliest sectarian atrocity in Iraq's recent history.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Falih Hassan, Ali Hamza and Omar al-Jawoshy from Baghdad, and an employee of The New York Times from Najaf, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: Ali Hussein Kadhim, an Iraqi soldier, was captured with hundreds of other soldiers by Sunni militants in June. As a Shiite, he was marked for death. [Video includes graphic images.]

headline.seo: Video Feature: Surviving an ISIS Massacre [includes graphic images]
headline.print_headline: ‘A Great Will to Live’: How One Man Survived an ISIS Massacre
